name: Lewisia
description: Lewisia is a genus of about 20 species of perennials in the family Montiaceae, all native to western North America.These low-growing plants are known for their attractive, fleshy leaves and large flowers in a variety of colors. The flowers are cup-shaped and have many petals. The most popular species are Lewisia cotyledon, also known as Cliff Maid, and Lewisia rediviva, commonly called Bitterroot.
meaning: The genus was named in honor of Meriwether Lewis, of the famous explorer duo, Lewis and Clark.
color_description: The flowers come in shades of white, pink, purple, orange and red.
